title: Worship
introtext:
Our Philosophy of Worship
We worship to bless the Lord. Psalm 33:3 says, "Sing to Him a new song, Play skillfully with a shout of Joy!" With this we worship in Spirit and in Truth (John 4:24) as we help usher others into the throne of Grace with our voices and instruments. Colossians 3:16 says, "Let the word of Christ richly dwell within you, with all wisdom teaching and admonishing one another with psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with thankfulness in your heart to God." So Worship the Lord, for He is good and His mercy endures forever!

title: Our History
introtext:
Calvary Chapel Southwest Metro began in June of 2003 as a church plant of Calvary Chapel Fort Worth.

Our first ten months were spent in the chapel of the Laurel Land Funeral Home (201 W. Bufford St., Burleson, 817-295-5211), who graciously donated the space free of charge. Easter morning of 2004 was our first meeting in our current home, located at 130 E. Renfro, Burleson. With over 28,000 square feet of room, this new facility, which was the former First Methodist Church building, was truly a blessing from God to our small but growing fellowship.  When the property changed hands and was eventually leased to Hill College, we were allowed to continue having services in the facility and currently meet in the main sanctuary on Sunday mornings and Wednesday evenings.

Listen below to story of our humble beginnings.
